definition: preface/foreword/preamble/recital (law)/also written 敘文|叙文[xu4 wen2]

sentences.english: The preface is written on the suce of the furnace that faces the space facilities.
sentences.chinese: 序文寫正在面對太空設施的火爐外貌。

sentences.english: "Agreement" shall have the meaning defined in the preamble.
sentences.chinese: “協議”，其含義與序文中所作界定相同。

sentences.english: Fifthly, the Preface of the Song-xian-guan Qin-pu may lose a paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 第五，《松弦館琴譜》序文或有一段佚文。

sentences.english: Bro. Tam has agreed for spreading his Preface of Dharma Nectar of Medicine Guru Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 譚文信已經同意可以分享他的藥師法露序文。

definition: author's preface/autobiographical notes as introduction to a book
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
notes on the use of a book/guide to the reader
to compose (a piece of writing)/to write/(written) work/writer
my unworthy writing (humble expr.)/my worthless manuscript
